src:
7 Petinju Bengkulu ke Final, Targetkan Lolos ke PON
07 Nov 2019, 14:12 by Roki EP


7 Petinju Bengkulu ke Final, Targetkan Lolos ke PON

KBRN, Bengkulu : Setelah lolos dalam pertandingan babak semi final, sebanyak 34 atlit Cabang Olahraga (Cabor) Tinju Pekan Olahraga Wilayah (Porwil) X Sumatera Bengkulu dari 8 Provinsi, akan berlaga di babak final yang akan berlangsung pada Jumat (8/11/2019) di Gedung Balai Buntar, Kota Bengkulu.
Dari 34 atlit tinju tersebut, sebanyak 7 atlit tinju berasal dari Bengkulu. Dimana ke tujuh atlit cabor tinju Porwil X Sumatera dari Bengkulu itu terdiri 4 putri dan 3 putra adalah, Gity Srinita dari kelas 45 kilogram, Sindy Marsela kelas 48 kilogram, Marviana Efrida kelas 57 kilogram, dan Falya Natarisa kelas 64 kilogram.
Lalu Michael Awuy dari kelas 60 kilogram, Yahanis Basik kelas 69 kilogram dan Renfry Arcos untuk kelas 91 kilogram.
Ketua Pengprov Persatuan Tinju Amatir Indonesia-Pertina Bengkulu Atisar Sulaiman ketika dihubungi menyampaikan rasa syukur dan selamat atas lolosnya sebanyak 7 atlit tinju Porwil Bengkulu ke babak final.
Oleh karena itu dalam pertandingan babak final yang jadwalnya dimajukan satu jam dari semula, bisa berjalan dengan baik dan sesuai rencana.
“Diharapkan ketujuh atlit tinju Porwil X Sumatera dari Bengkulu ini bisa meraih juara dan mendapatkan medali emas, serta lolos menuju Pekan Olahraga Nasional (PON) pada tahun 2020 di Papua. Apalagi jika mengacu pada target awal, hanya sebanyak 5 emas, tapi melihat peluang yang lolos ke babak final sebanyak 7 orang atlit, bukan tidak mungkin, raihan untuk mendapatkan medali emas bisa berlebih nantinya,” kata Atisar, Kamis, (7/11/2019).
Lebih jauh target untuk lolos ke PON, Atisar menjelaskan, meski pihaknya tidak berani menargetkan untuk seluruh atlitnya yang lolos ke babak final ini, namun dari perkiraan sementara karena ada kriteria khususnya, paling tidak 4 atau 5 atlit bisa lolos ke PON.
Apalagi se Sumatera ini, ada atlit tinju dari daerah lain juga berjuang untuk bisa juara dalam Porwil X Sumatera, sebagai salah syarat lolos.
“Saya berpesan khususnya kepada para atlit tinju asal Bengkulu agar dapat menjaga sportifitas demi nama baik daerah, dan berjuang secara maksimal, sehingga nantinya bisa memenangkan pertandingan final serta lolos ke PON,” harapnya.
Sementara dari 34 atlit tinju baik putra maupun putri yang lolos ke final, selain 7 orang asal Bengkulu, juga ada Kepulauan Riau 7 orang, Lampung 3 orang, Sumatera Utara 6 orang, Riau juga 6 orang. Kemudian dari Sumatera Barat 1 orang, Jambi 3 orang dan Bangka Belitung 1 orang.
text:
7 Bengkulu Boxers to Final, Target Pass to PON
Nov 7 2019, 14:12 by Roki EP


7 Bengkulu Boxers to Final, Target Pass to PON

KBRN, Bengkulu: After qualifying in the semi-final round match, as many as 34 athletes in the Boxing Sports Week Region (Porwil) X Sumatra Bengkulu from 8 Provinces, will compete in the final round which will take place on Friday (11/08/2019 ) in Balai Buntar Building, Bengkulu City.
Of the 34 boxing athletes, as many as 7 boxing athletes came from Bengkulu. Whereas the seven Porwil X Sumatra boxing athletes from Bengkulu consisted of 4 daughters and 3 sons, Gity Srinita from the 45 kilogram class, Sindy Marsela for the 48 kilogram class, Marviana Efrida for the 57 kilogram class, and Falya Natarisa for the 64 kilogram class.
Then Michael Awuy from 60 kilograms class, Yahanis Basik 69 kilograms class and Renfry Arcos for 91 kilograms class.
The Head of Pengprov of the Indonesian Boxing Association of Pertina Bengkulu-Bengkulu Atisar Sulaiman when contacted expressed gratitude and congratulations for the passage of 7 boxing athletes Porwil Bengkulu to the final round.
Therefore, in the final round match which is scheduled to be advanced an hour from the beginning, it can run well and according to plan.
"It is hoped that the seven boxing athletes of the Porwil X Sumatra from Bengkulu can win and win gold medals, and qualify for the National Sports Week (PON) in 2020 in Papua. Especially when referring to the initial target, only 5 gold, but seeing the opportunity to qualify for the final round of 7 athletes, it is not impossible, the achievement to get a gold medal can be excessive later, "Atisar said on Thursday (11/07/2019) ).
Furthermore, the target to qualify for PON, Atisar explained, although his party did not dare to target all of the athletes who qualify for this final round, but from a temporary estimate due to specific criteria, at least 4 or 5 athletes could qualify for PON.
Moreover, throughout Sumatra, there are boxing athletes from other regions who are also fighting to win the Regional Champion X Sumatra, as one of the requirements to qualify.
"I especially advised the boxing athletes from Bengkulu to be able to maintain sportsmanship in the name of the region, and fight to the maximum, so that later they could win the final match and qualify for the PON," he hoped.
While of the 34 boxing athletes both male and female who qualified for the finals, in addition to 7 people from Bengkulu, there were also Riau Islands 7 people, Lampung 3 people, North Sumatra 6 people, Riau also 6 people. Then from West Sumatra 1 person, Jambi 3 people and Bangka Belitung 1 person.
